caption: The food was ok !!

Delicious. The server kept called us "my friend" which wasn't great but he was friendly. We did the restaurant week menu. The mushroom soup was wonderful. The crab cake was AMAZING. ORDER IT. The coconut curry risotto is delicious. The creme caramel was not worth it in any way. The french 75 cocktail was the best I'd ever had. The viva la verde was good on its own but didn't really match any food pairings.

Really enjoyed my experience! I am visiting from an area with 0 vegan restaurants. This was such a treat. Food was amazing, staff were gracious and professional, vibe was quite nice. Can't ask for more! Portions were generous or skillful/creative enough to match price well. This ended a perfect Chicago day.
Incredible. Love the atmosphere, the staff is happy to describe all the flavors of the menu and the food is out of this world amazing. Can't wait to go back!
Favorite small plates plant based restaurant in Chicago

The food was AMAZING... do not get me wrong. The women there were so kind to me and my friend but we had a male server and he definitely did NOT want to be there and or had an weird animosity toward my friend and I. I work in the food industry and know how to be respectful and kind to servers I just felt unwanted and unwelcomed because of him. I want to give him the benefit of the doubt bc maybe he was having a bad day? But then again don’t take it out on me ?

First time visiting! Love they are all plant based! The food all looked beautiful! The cheese platter was fun to try as they were all three very different from one another. Our main dishes were also good and pretty flavorful. Unfortunately our cheesecake was very frozen and we could hardly even eat the crust with the cheesecake itself. Having a very frozen cheesecake also changed the overall texture and it honestly is not something we’d want to try again and the reason for 4 stars overall!

The general manager, Kelly, is exceptional. On Christmas Eve, we ordered the holiday special for pickup, and after arriving home (30min from the restaurant), we realized the portion size of the main dish was smaller than expected. We called and spoke with Kelly. She went above and beyond to deliver us another portion of the dish free of charge, with a few drinks thrown in as well. She turned what could have been a sour experience into an expression of generosity, truly embodying the spirit of the holidays. Thanks, Kelly!
Service was excellent, recommended.

We ate here several times at Althea when we were in Chicago. The food is wonderful - delicious and innovative. The service is great - the staff is attentive and very helpful. They clearly know the menu very well and can explain it if you have any concerns or just need advice. The views are also terrific! We ended up going to Althea three times and tasted most of the menu. We enjoyed everything. We're looking forward to a return trip to Althea .... Once we can travel again.
7 floor in Saks 5th Avenue

Due to the COVID restrictions, we couldn't dine in but we did takeout and got  kimchi dumplings, barbacoa taco, noodle soup with tempeh, curry risotto, and the chai spice cheesecake. I think my least favorite dish were the dumplings because the stuffing just seemed too mushy, I am not sure if it's because it doesn't travel well. Another dish i wasnt too impressed by was the curry soup. I just found it to be underwhelming, taste-wise. But, the taco was delish. I could eat three of those as an entree. The risotto with cauliflower was very tasty and the cheesecake was scrumptious. All in all a very good experience but like in any other restaurants, it depends on what you order.
Delicious! got carry-out during 2nd covid surge
Great service, great view. It feels like a vegan restaurant you'd experience in LA. Loved it!

Good vegan food but simply not worth the wait. We waited well over 50 minutes until our main course was served.  The main course was (1) risotto and (2) udon. None of these items require so long for preparation so we are really clueless of what might have happened. The server endured that this was a normal wait time though - so I guess beware.  Crab cakes were on top ($14 for 3 pieces) Udon is 3 out of 5 ($19 - ouch!) Risotto was 4 out of 5 ($18 - ok)  I guess I wish the server admitted the mistake and tried making things right. Negligence to admit the mistake and overall high price will stir me away from this place in the future.  Drinks are good  Cheers

We loved Wild seed. All seven of us. Inventive flavors. Great service. Alluring ambiance. The childless with soyrizo were to die for. Frittatas, amazing. Fritters, could eat them all day. Really fantastic all around.
Creative, fancy ,nourishing ,beautifully presented .Special. Polenta dish with Kale  pesto lacked flavor but still cannot wait to return .Thanks for giving vegan a good rep.

I’m surprised to learn that that they do not carry nonalcoholic beer at this restaurant. They have beers here that range from seven dollars to nine dollars, but nothing in the nonalcoholic variety. That is something that definitely needs to be changed.  They do have house cocktails which range from $14-$15 that can be mixed spirit-free—For the same price.  This pricing doesn’t make any sense: if you leave out the most expensive part of the drink— the alcohol – the price should go down accordingly.  It would be different if these drinks just used some ordinary bottom shelf spirits, but they use really fancy stuff like Chairman’s Reserve Spiced rum and Ransom Old Town gin.  Since this is a vegan restaurant it should be pretty easy for them to do the math and fix these prices, because vegans are sensitive to discriminatory pricing, Justice people who don’t drink alcohol recognize that booze-free drinks should cost considerably less

Fellow carnivores, although this is a plant based restaurant it is also for you! Food was amazing, my favorite being the chickpea frittata (pictured). Was the perfect easy lunch with an incredible view overlooking downtown.

So good! Such a creative kitchen to make veggies taste, feel, and act like meat in new ways. Makes you wonder how other chefs call themselves creative when all they do is puree something and call it deconstructed. Try making kimchi feel like ground meat! Crazy! Favs were kimchi, crabcakes, and bbq tacos.
Excellent spot for lunch or a date. The staff was very friendly and knowledgeable. Everything was delicious. Hope to return soon.

Absolute terrible experience at Althea. Called ahead for a team lunch for their restaurant week menu. They knew a large group was coming for their set menu and it took FOREVER to get our food. Food was pretty disgusting, staff was not helpful. The coconut ice cream literally tasted like vomit, everyone around our table of 12 thought the same. What was supposed to be an hour and half break for lunch turned into an hour longer, please note most guests had to leave early and we had to bring their lunch back to the office because it took so long to get our food. Cherry on top is that a chair broke. We expressed our concerns over everything and they only comped one meal "only because her chair broke". I will never suggest this restaurant and will never go back ever again.
Such a great place ❤️
Althea is definitely a must go to restaurant if you're in Chicago!

I really have to start getting better about taking pix of my food BEFORE I start chowing down. I have been up and down Michigan Ave a million times and never noticed the sign for this place. Today I did and I’m glad I did. The food was fabulous! lol ordered the barbacoa tacos and crab cakes with a glass of wine for an afternoon snack. Small portions but so yummy. Tacos are $5 a piece so o got two. The crab cakes were three small cakes but between the two was just enough. Add a glass of wine and your day is made. Next time I’ll order an entree and take pix before I devour it!
Amazing amazing amazing! Vegan or not, the food is just absolutely fantastic!
Delicious vegan meal
Delicious but Sooooo overpriced!   Lasagna 22.00 had to cost under 1 dollar to make:(
Best high end vegan restaurant in chicago

This is one of the best vegan restaurants in Chicago. The taste matches the presentation in every way. I've had several menu items and they've all been great. Their desserts are very good too. And I can't forget to mention the spectacular view.
Friendly staff great food!
Lovely little restaurant located inside Saks fifth Ave. Beautiful ambiance and friendly wait staff. The food was delicious and gorgeous presentation!
Amazing vegan food with great service and a nice view! Must do while you are visiting Chicago! Highly recommended! #govegan
Amazing food great service
Love the concept and food.  So far my favorites are the curry risotto and spicy udon noodles.  Desserts could be more flavorful (I would skip) but overall a wonderful experience.
Great Vegan options. Pleasantly surprised.
Great food and drink menu

Food was delicious and staff was so friendly. Given that all the menu items are vegan I was a little hesitant but came away very impressed. The chickpea fratatta is amazing and their pistachio ice cream was a treat!

Lovely open space concept tucked neatly into the NE corner of Saks Fifth. A fun, filling plant-based experience with delicious classics. For plant-based eaters, this is fine dining, for us. For skeptics, this is an upscale introduction into the future of food.

So happy to have Althea in Chicago!  The service was good, our waitress was attentive and paced our meal nicely since we ordered quite a few dishes.  I would highly recommend the Kimchi dumplings. The coconut wrap is outstanding and made in house with dehydrated coconut & cilantro. The filling had a light nuttiness with a beautiful umami flavor. We ordered 2 plates, it was that good. The mushroom tacos were highly recommended and were just okay. The seasoning of the mushrooms were delicious and well prepared but the tortilla tasted store bought and a bit old. It wasn't anything more than a standard taco in my opinion. The anipasti platter was thoughtful and flavorful - the olive oil cashews were delicous and the pickled beets were flavorful. I loved the stuffed olives too, it's rare to get a vegan stuffed olive anywhere! My husband had the flatbread and loved it. I had the kelp cacio de pepe which was absloutely amazing. My only critique was that it needed more pepper and olives. I asked for more pepper on the side, which made it divine. The briny saltiness  of the olives was outstanding but there were only a few small chunks, having more would have been amazing.  We didn't save room for dessert but hope to have some next time. The setting is really inviting yet simple. We sat by the window with great views of Michigan Ave. They are currently BYOB for a short while, it's nice to have the option to bring alcohol. I look forward to their wine selections once they receive the license. We will be back for sure!

Even if you are not vegan, you absolutely need to try the cuisine at Althea. Some of the most mouth watering food I’ve ever had. So many flavors and options for everyone on the menu. We had the crab cakes, coconut curry risotto, kelp noodle cacio e Pepe, and finished with the chocolate cashew cheesecake. Chef Matthew Kenney is a genius with flavors and I cannot wait to try more of his dishes.
Nice place. Little of a pain to find and there's not a great selection on the menu but overall had a nice time.
Very good vegan food. A bit pricey. The servers tried to bring us somebody else's food 2 different times.

We decided to try Althea out during Restaurant Week and were not disappointed by the food we got.  Everything, sans the Little Gem Cesar, which we found a bit underwhelming and bland, blew us away.  The Barboca Taco was packed with flavor and set our expectations high for the rest of the meal. The Kelp Noodle Cacio e Pepe was the real winner for me. Absolutely delicious!  We tried the Seasonal Flatbread (kale with truffle oil if I remember correctly) and quite enjoyed that too.  For dessert, we tried the Tahini Ice Cream, something I could eat an entire carton of if given the chance, and the Pineapple Coconut Sorbet, which was light and refreshing, better suited for the spring or summer in my opinion.  What we had a major issue with was our server. We inquired about the Restaurant Week brunch menu and were told it was only available Sundays, which is fine as we weren't aware. However, he never followed up with letting us know the lunch course was an option. We had to ask the hostess, who was very nice and got us the menu to order from.  Bad impression aside from our server, we'd go again to try some of the other dishes and definitely sample more desserts.
Holy F.  Plant based food finally done right.  Bravo!
Amazing vegan food, great decor and awesome staff especially our server Devin! This place is definitely worth a visit! The crab cakes and the lasagna are excellent.
Easily the best vegan place in the city! Beautiful views too.

I'm giving ALTHEA one star because I was blown away by the sheer mediocrity of the food. I could've spent five dollars on a cheap vegan frozen meal at the grocery store and would've enjoyed it more. The price of the food is not at all warranted given its taste and quality. This was in addition to an incredibly long wait time (45 minutes) to be served. If you're looking for good vegan food, go elsewhere. I had really high hopes given the other reviews, so my experience was disappointing to say the least.
Great vegan spot. Odd being in a Saks but they did a great job and will return!

The food was amazing! I went for brunch with friends, none of whom are plant based/vegan. We were all blown away by the delicious flavors. The best part was the free scones! The view from the dining room was amazing too.
super meal especially recommend the Brussels sprouts flatbread!!!

Had a wonderful brunch! We received complimentary scones, had great service and loved that the cappuccino and lattes were made with oat milk. My friend and I split the Toast Flight and Upside Down Pancake, and since the latter takes 20 minutes it worked perfectly because it was cake-like and pretty much dessert! Everything was very yummy. Can't wait to go back again :)

Fantastic vegan fine dining with great service excellent food.  This place is so good! I have no idea why it isn’t packed out months in advance but I’m grateful it wasn’t because it meant I got to eat dinner AND brunch here.  Everything is plant based which means it’s good for vegans and vegetarians but the omnivores I came with loved it as well  The staff was friendly and helpful and everything we had was original fresh and delicious. Will definitely becoming back next time I’m in Chicago

Althea is a 100% vegan restaurant with lots of options that do not include fake meat or soy. They also have raw options. We made a reservation and they had an amazing table for us by the window.  Service was OUTSTANDING.  There were so many options on the menu it was difficult to decide what to order. We had the kimchi dumplings, crab cakes, veggie burger and chickpea frittata.  The dumplings and crab cakes were excellent.  The chickpea frittata had a super fresh delicious salad on top.  The frittata was very heavy, dense, and dry.  The veggie burger was overcooked and a little dry. Although we didn't really like the entrees that we ordered we would definitely go back and try different entrees.

Delicious! Great views, comfortable atmosphere, and friendly staff.  Everything on the menu looked delicious. I had a bowl of soup and the risotto; both were excellent. Might go back tomorrow night just to try a few other things that were on the menu.

Great place for plant-based food.  I had the crab cakes, kelp noodles, and coconut cream pie tonight, and it was all delicious.  Service was excellent as well. I'll definitely be dining here more often.

Amazing plant based (fully vegan) resturant in Saks Fith Avenue department store, level 7. Resturant is casual yet upscale at the same time, tucked away and is surprisingly comfortable/cozy. Portions are generous which was a nice surprise.  I can't wait to go back!  Ordered: •Little Gem cesar salad •Kimchi pancakes (our favorite, must try!!) •Barbacoa tacos + complimentary apple scones w/butter & apple butter (nice surprise)

Amazing! We just had our second meal at ALTHEA and it did not disappoint. Each dish has unique, complex flavors that meld perfectly. Kaylin has been our server for both of our visits and she is very friendly and helpful. Unfortunately, we don't live in Chicago, but we go to Althea every time we are in town. Try the Barbacoa Taco!

Beautifully presented and delicious health-conscious food. The kimchi dumplings are an absolute must. The spicy udon was extremely flavorful and appropriately portioned, though admittedly not too spicy. However, the maple cheesecake was the definite star - creamy, tangy, and crunchy. I would love to come back!
Love this place! Service is great!! And food is very delicious, I never eat better VEGAN food than there! Definitely recommend!

The appetizers and drinks were good but unfortunately, the service was very slow. It took 2 hrs for us to get our dinner ready. It was not until I said we were leaving that our food came out. The manager  apologized but I did see she was attending to other tables and not ours. The waitress was aware of our very delayed food but not once did she check on us until I said we were leaving. Unfortunately, we will not go back to this restaurant. The dumplings are way over priced to just get 3! Side note,  the dumplings was the free meal we got for our over delayed food.
Food is amazing!
Delicious. Unique vegan. Tastiest I've had in a while

Do yourself a favor... make a reservation stat! Ask for a table against the windows for an amazing view! I didn't mind having my back to the glass because I had the best view in the place(cheesy yeah, that's why I said it.). The food was out of this world! The layering of flavors, presentation and kindness from the staff made our date night an experience for the books.
Absolutely amazing. My new favorite restaurant.
Promising restaurant, but the food lacks a soul. Everything was nice / okayish. The only thing i didn't like was the burger. It tasted like bad falafel burger.
Delicious food and great service!
Great 100% plant based menu. Food is really tasty, beautifully presented and served with a big smile. Meals are cooked with passion so it takes its time, so sit down, relax, and enjoy your food.
Amazingly delicious good, fantastic ! Service was impeccable. Strong and great drinks
Excellent vegan choices. Excellent taste and excellent service received.
Wonderful service and amazing food!

Althea supports the hypothesis that if you're in a town you don't know, just find the best vegan restaurant near you and you won't be disappointed.  Food was delightful, staff friendly, chatty and fun and entering via the (closed) cosmetic section of a department store a new experience for me!
Excellent food

A group of 5 friends came here and had a lovely meal. There were some ups and downs with our waitress but we had a great experience overall. Our group decided to order family style. Some dishes are definitely standouts but all were very good. I will give a quick rundown of our order below: - Kimchi dumplings (raw) 10/10 - these are EPIC! I could have ordered 3 plates for myself. The table agreed these were the best dish of the night - Crab cakes 10/10 - these were a close second best dish following the dumplings. The are mild tasting yet super flavorful and have a nice crispy outside yet soft inside. - The Plant Bowl - 10/10 - Essentially a 'buddha bowl' but absolutely amazing! This was the largest portion we ordered. It was a quinoa and lentil base toped with a ton of fresh, roasted veggies. This is what I strive to make my lunches taste like but I'm far from it. - Kung Pao Cauliflower - 9/10 - excellent flavor, the sauce was delicious. Perfect combination of salty and sweet - The Cacio e Pepe (raw) 6/10 - light and lacking complexity of flavor -very pepper heavy - The Lasagna (raw) *4/10* - I personally didn't care for this dish but my friends loved it. I don't think I liked they cold 'cheese' and the zucchini noodles.  We also ordered dessert... We came hungry - Coconut Creme Pie - 8/10 - super interesting for a raw dessert to taste so good. I was pleasantly surprised. It tasted more banana heavy than coconut. - Hibiscus Strawberry Cheesecake - 6/10 - Not a highlight for me. Didn't love the lime curd but then again it is just personal preference. The others loved it. Guess I'm more of a chocolate dessert person - Ice Cream flight - 9/10 - The have 5 ice creams and you get to pick three. We opted for Mint, Rocky Road and the Salted Caramel. They were so creamy you would never know they weren't make with dairy products. The Salted caramel was the clear winner. The mint left a lot to be desired.  Overall - we left very happy and ended up with a $200 bill which wasn't too bad for how much we ordered. We did BYOB with no corkage fee which saved us money. I am looking forward to my next meal here and would love to try the brunch!
Great food but not so great atmosphere. Also their servings are rather small, the cake for instance was for very tiny bites of deliciousness
The food is good but the portions are super tiny. I guess that's what you get when you visit a restaurant by a "Michelin starred chef".

Just go here.  The quality and flavors will make you forget about the absent meat. You will only regret that you can't try everything. After Saks closes, security is there to let people go up to this restaurant. I figured this out after a walk around the block. Once in, it felt like I knew a secret that nobody else did. It seemed I had discovered an exclusive dining club...that was open to anyone and very welcoming. On approach, the bar was empty and, for a moment, I thought I was going to awkwardly be the only one there...but I rounded the corner to a VERY nice restaurant space.  Good atmosphere with just the right amount of ambient noise from the many others who were also clearly thrilled to be enjoying this secret place. I had the Barbacoa Taco -  Mushrooms were great and the sauces and garnish were too but I just wanted more of them. The Spicy Udon bowl was a masterpiece.  Easily the best bowl I've ever had. The warm and spicy cashew-hoisin (hoisin...hoisin...) sauce was a touch spicy but not overwhelming. I dunked the cashews and tempeh in to get them fully coated and they came out very tasty.  Lastly, the little scoop of Tahini Ice Cream (cashew base) was just right to finish off a very filling meal.  It was creamy, not too sweet and very interesting. The sesame seeds and caramel on top were nice. The waitstaff was friendly.  Everyone was working hard and keeping things moving and my water glass full.  I never felt rushed and got some great info about the menu and ingredients. If you're still reading this, stop now and go find this place and experience it for yourself!

Beautiful Restaurant, located inside Saks on the 7th floor. Cheeseboard was phenomenal, couldn’t even noticed it wasn’t “real” cheese, we ate so fast that wasn’t able to take a picture. Spicy Udon and Chickpea Fritata was perfectly plated and the flavors were amazing. It is pricy but totally worth it. They don’t have the price on google yet but I would say $$$.
Fantastic, got the udon main with the assorted platter as an app, portions are on the small side but quality is excellent. Get in here while it's still BYOB, they're getting their liquor license soon
Love this place! Great, innovative food. Friendly staff. Definitely try the cheese plate and spicy udon and every dessert!
Outstanding in EVERY way. Go. Now.

A vegan hidden gem tucked inside the 7th floor of Saks 5th Avenue and away from the bustling tourist crowds in the Magnificent Mile. My hubby and I feasted on a bunch of dishes all bursting with flavor.  Barbacoa Taco (5/5) - If you love mushrooms, get it! Lots of great flavor packed into the tacos with oyster and maitake mushrooms, crunchy pepitas, greens, and pepita cream.  Mushroom Veggie Burger (5/5) - Hand-down my favorite entree! The house-made scrumptious breaded veggie burger topped with melted cheese and a meaty slice of tomato sandwiched between a soft broiche bun hit the spot! Even my hubby who despises mushrooms with a passion loved the burger and couldn't taste the mushrooms.  Spicy Udon (5/5) - The rich creamy coconut curry sauce with udon noodles, tenpeh, shiitake mushrooms, crunchy cashews, and bok choy was a nice hearty savory dish.  Basil Sunflower Pesto Flatbread (3/5) - The flatbread was bland and boring, and the only dish I wouldn't order again. I would save my appetite for other dishes.  Apple Beet Strawberry Basil Juice (5/5) - The cold-pressed fresh juice was refreshing with a great blend of fruits.  Secret Garden Mocktail (5/5) The Lavender and Rose Syrup was too sugary sweet for me. Some vodka would have been perfect to cut it!  When I visited a few weeks ago in July, the restaurant hadn't obtained a liquor license so it was BYOB and about to get their liquor license.  Excited to come back to try cocktails and explore the rest of the menu! Delicious vegan food that even my meat-lovin hubby enjoyed!
Delicious! Wonderful experience! Extremely friendly staff! Love it.
I just happened to find this special place and I am so overjoyed!  The gazpacho was delicious but then the coconut curry risotto was out of this world! Thank you 🙏
By far the best vegan food I've ever had!

This place was awesome.  I considered re-rating all prior 5 star reviews I had made to make room as this place totally raised the bar.  Kelp cacio and pepe was one of the best Italian dishes I've ever had... And it was raw vegan.  Mind totally blown.  Kimchi dumplings also raw vegan and delicious.  We tried 5 plates and every one was amazing.  Atmosphere and view were nice and customer service was pleasant.  Great restaurant and an unbelievable plus that it's 100% vegan.
10/10. I am from Saudi Arabia and this is the first time I actually enjoy hummus outside the region. Impeccable execution throughout all the courses. Yay veganism!
Super good! There were both raw and cooked options. My kelp noodles were amazing, and our kimchi dumplings were killer
Food was outstanding. Nice views of Michigan Ave.
It was great and intimate
We absolutely loved every dish that we got here. It’s such a funky little restaurant but with amazing high-quality food.

Service was excellent, food was amazing, and the atmosphere was inviting. When we went it was BYOB with no corking surcharge, but I would call before hand to verify. I am already excited to go back! Ever sense my girlfriend and I have changed our diet to plant based only, it has been hard to find good tasting food without removing everything. Coming here was a dream! Everything we ate tasted amazing! Their desserts are a must! Definitely try their lasagna. This is a must try for a date night!

We’re in Chicago once a year and are always excited to try restaurants from this amazing food-city…especially if they’ve got good vegetarian (and gluten free) options. Althea came right up on our search for that criteria and so we made a reservation! We didn’t realize it at the time, but the restaurant was created by Matthew Kenney, who created Plant Food + Wine in Venice, CA (in our neck of the woods) and, as it turned out, the menu was similar. I kind of with the restaurants were named the same so my expectations of trying a “new” place were not slightly disappointed with this realization. hat having been said there are differences and the food was top notch.  My wife (an alum of 2 Matthew Kenney classes in Southern Cal) had the Plant Bowl. She found it to be delicious and filling. It was a lentil and quinoa concoction with a shmear of red pepper sauce, along with carrots, spring radishes and broccolini She found it very satisfying and beautiful to look it.  I had the Kimchi Dumplings. These are served raw in a wrapper made of dehydrated coconut  “meat” and cilantro. This coconut based “dough” was completely legitimate on these dumplings, and the cashew “cheese” an cabbage purée it was on top of it made a delightful dish for my palette.  I also had a Barbacoa Taco - This was also super tasty. It’s served warm and is mushroom based. I had so much flavor. I could’ve eaten a lot of these.  I didn’t so much like the Blackberry + Sage “mocktail.”  It lists ingredients in this order; Housemade Blackberry + Sage Syrup. Lemon Juice, Rose Water and organic Agave. The drink looked pretty but in the end the only flavor that really came through was the lemon juice and I felt like I was drinking a pink lemonade. I would have loved the blackberry and sage flavors to come through…the rosewater too…but I couldn’t identify any of them in this drink and I ended up sending it back.  We shared the Coconut Cream Pie for dessert. My wife felt  it should be called  “banana coconut cream pie” as she said “the banana really shouts at you”. I really liked it. It had a great coconut and banana flavor and I never would have guessed it was dairy free. It also was a good size portion for sharing. My wife thought was too sweet (it’s sweetened with dates and maple syrup.) But she and I will just have to disagree on that point.  Fine dining all vegan restaurants are not on every street corner, so if you are in Chicago and not  necessarily over familiar with their other restaurants, this’ll be a good and novel upscale experience for you.

I liked the place. Servers are very friendly. Food is interesting but taste wise could do better. Or it was a coincidence that the 2 things I ordered were very sour. Lasagna n some cashew appetizer. But my husband got gnocchi as that was good.
Excellent vegan options. Some of the tastiest food am incredible service. A must go to spot for any vegan in Chicago. A bit tricky to get into because it’s in the mall.
Everything was delicious. Staff was nice. ♡
The staff was amazingly freindly and went above and beyond to fit my dietary needs!

This would have been an easy 5 star, but because an incident when we arrived it's not. We came in for a late reservation and were sat at a not so great table. I pointed out to the hostess that we wanted to sit at the window table with the beautiful view. She said that we couldn't because it was a four top and there were only two of us. I asked if she had any reservations for 4 people (mind you, this is 15 minutes before they close the doors for new guests) and she said she didn't... I proposed that we could have the table if no party of 4 walked in within the next couple of minutes and she agreed. Two minutes later, another couple walks in and gets sat by another hostess (or manager?), they also request the window table and are immediately sat there. I flag down "our" hostess and ask her what happened with our arrangement,  but unfortunately she had no answer. Anyway, just annoying and unprofessional. I hope somebody teaches her how to be more flexible. Aside from this, service was excellent and food was outstanding. I will go back next time in Chicago.

Althea blew our expectations out of the water. It was our first meal during our visit and each item was incredible including the mushroom tacos, chickpea fritter and the flatbread with pesto. They don’t have their liquor license yet which was fine, because we were able to save some money and buy a bottle a wine from Trader Joe’s nearby, and bring it with us. The service was fantastic. Danny took care of us and made great recommendations and helped speed up our order because he knew we had a show to make it to. HIGHLY RECOMMEND!
Beautiful ambiance. Excellent food. Heaven for vegans!
Great high end upscale vegan restaurant downtown chicago. Love the food, ambiance and service. My server Miko was great! Try the tacos 🌮 😋

Excellent! A great gem hidden in the 700 N Michigan building on the 7th floor. The interior is clean, modern. Inviting and exciting. The view is great! The staff are all so joyful and happy, I enjoyed their banter and service! The food is just superb, with vegan dishes to surprise your taste buds! The "lasagne" (pictured) was incredible: a tower of sliced zucchini with two raw vegan spreads of cashew "ricotta" and sun-dried tomato "marinara". The flavors were delicious, don't let the raw part deter you from this dish!  Definitely get dessert. The apple pie was so good! We will be back.

Marvelous place for a very satisfying vegan meal!  This place is not super easy to find as Google map makes it looks like it's on N Rush St, but it's inside Saks Fifth which entrance is on Michigan and  Superior. It's on the 7th floor of the building.  The environment is neat and nice. They combined two window tables for us to allow us to have a better view while enjoying the meal.  We tried the taco, and it's so good! The mushroom in there makes every bite burst with flavors. The butternut squash gnocchi is probably my favorite so far, it's warm and comforting, the right balance of mushroom and gnocchi. Zucchini lasagna is less surprising. It's an interesting idea, but I feel like it may taste better if it's a warm dish? That can be just a personal preference. The highlight of the dinner is the new Tiramisu! Instead of layers, it comes with wedges of chocolate and coconut cream. While the mains dishes are kind of small portion, this dessert is pretty big. Three of us shared one and that's enough for sure (we are not super big eater on sweets). But you should save room for this!

Fabulous plant based deliciousness. Classy dining room with 7th floor views.Tip:Reserve a table by the windows. Artisanal Cheese Plate- rich flavors , beautifully presented, filling. Little Gem Caesar-  fresh, bold   Caesar with high quality greens.Light on dressing for my preference .Margherita Pizza, nut cheese is delish and the sauce..ok .Could have been garnished better. Maybe sprinkled with fine chop herbs. Flatbread  was too soft for my preference. Our mains, Spicy Udon,-incredible flavor and expertly prepared.Plant Bowl, loaded with perfectly roasted Root vegetables Black Lentils and Quinoa combo made it out of this world! Polenta Verde. A creative and lovely dish but Kale Pesto lacked flavor. If you prefer low garlic and salt this is for you .My sister in law loved it! This is a world class dining experience Chicago is fortunate to have. Non vegan/vegetarians will be impressed so take 'em along.

The atmosphere, view of Michigan Ave and service are exceptional. Our server and host were both very nice and helpful. I don’t think I would come back but it was definitely worth the initial experience. The cheese plate and udon noodles with tempeh were both phenomenal. We did not like the caesar salad. The cauliflower was fine. I liked that the gnocci were crispy/fried, but the overall dish was just okay.

Food is well prepared and very clean. The Kelp noodles were very good with a wonderful texture- not chewy or tough; the bite is like an al dente pasta and has a great olive/brine flavor. The Kung Pao cauliflower sauce was very good and not too sweet with well balanced flavors and nice ginger notes. Veggies are cooked well. GF options available. Desserts are only ok though.
Great food, amazing view over Michigan Avenue.
High end and fully vegan, and you won’t even know it. Best for me was the spicy udon. Apps and desserts were creative. Service great. Located in Saks in Michigan Ave.
Great vegetarian restaurant
Great spot for dining!! Nice views too. Wish it had a street front as it deserves better visibility and can't wait for them to get their liquor license.

Everything was ALMOST there. Starting with getting to the restuarant, you have to walk through Saks which really isn't an issue as long as you know where youre going (7th floor by the way). When you get off the elevator, there is a sign and you get greated by the host. They try to be very fancy with their environment, which is great if you are facing into the restaurant or are lucky enough to sit in the corner where the lights are dim, but if you are facing out, your view is the racks of clothes in Saks which takes away from the environment. Next is the service. Throughout the night we were greated with very inconsistent service. The host was great and even offered to take our coats, but the manager was sitting on her laptop with papers spread all over the table next to the entrence, again taking away from the experience (even though that's normally not an issue for me, it just doesnt fit the environment they are trying to create). The server we had gave us what could be pub service at best. Order taker not server. I asked about Matthew Kenny and her only answer was "I don't know, he is a famous vegan chef". I found this odd since his name is on the door, shouldn't they know a bit more about him? They also didnt have a liquor license yet, which was totally fine, but their mocktails were not balenced at all, one just tasted of lemon juice, one was way too sweet. There were four options in total. The food was good, not great. The cheese plate was good, but small, which was to be expected. We asked for more crackers since the plate only came with five and we were brought out six more for a charge of five dollars (which we only found out about once we got the bill). One of the cheeses was five star, the other two were three or four star. Total was about an ounce and a half of cheese, two ounces of sliced apple and five crackers. Probably shouldn't have been 23 dollars, but I was okay with it since it is more fine dining. The caesar salad was made into this deconstructed salad with undressed romaine leaves, some capers and croutons and a light drizzle of what was more of an itallian dressing than a mock caesar dressing. The gnocchi & farro bolognese wasn't that at all, at best I would call it a tomato farro risotto with gnocchi mixed in. Flavors were good, but it was too heavy on the tomato and too light on the umami that you should get from a bolognese. The absolute highlight was the "tiramisu" which realistically was just a bunch of ingredients haphazardly tossed on a plate to look like a fancy "oops I dropped the dessert". Flavors were good, but I didn't get any coffee notes and I failed to see what on the dish was supposed to represent lady fingers. It was good, it just wasn't a tiramisu. All in all, very disapointing, I feel they have a ton of potential, but they just need to take a look at themselves in the mirror and drop the ego for long enough to truely judge what needs to be elevated to create the experience they are looking for.

My husband and I came here for Chicago Restaurant week. We both ordered different things so we could try the maximum amount. We have not gone to a 'fancy' vegan restaurant in a while and were very excited. Everything we had was delicious- the service was great, and the view was spectacular. We came on a snowy evening to celebrate an occasion and the restaurant is over-looking the water tower.  Our favorite dish was actually the Cesar salad! it was perfect for sharing and the salty-briney-ness was awesome. We loved picking up each leaf during our conversation and crunching into them. The amount of dressing was perfect and that makes such a big difference. I also tried a wine made from oranges which was so cool. It is a bit pricey but we felt like we got a good deal with doing the restaurant week.

Really amazing food.  You will barely even notice that it's all vegan!  Located on the 7th floor of Sax 5th Ave, this is a really quiet little restaurant with some of the nicest wait staff ever.  The food was out of this world.  Really thoughtful dishes and wonderful flavors that highlight just how delicious simple plant based foods can be.  Drinks, appetizers, mains and desserts were all top notch. Tacos were a great starter and the "cheese" plate was superb. Was a little disappointed that I couldn't get the tiramisu dessert but the apple pie was great.  This place is definitely pricey, but so worth it.  Zero regrets and will absolutely return.
My date night go-to spot. The food is just phenomenal. I recommend this place to everyone who wants to be impressed by plant based food.
Best plant based meal we've had in three years.  Amazing food and beautiful views of Michigan Avenue.  If you are in Chicago you have to try this restaurant.
I could write a really wordy review, but let’s leave it at this: I would literally die for any of the items on the menu.

We came to enjoy a nice romantic meal.  Delicious creative cuisine.  Flavorful and varied menu with a lot of options for different moods.  Friendly and classy service.  A chic modernist decor.  We had a beautiful view of water tower and lit trees along Michigan Ave.

We had a splendid dinner here! Creative cuisine, diverse dishes on the menu, everything was super fresh and flavorful.  The portions are generous but save room for the desserts! Good thing we didn’t have to choose between the coconut cream pie and apple pie with vanilla cashew ice cream- we devoured both. Nice views of Michigan Avenue.

Stunning Chicago views!  The most amazing and the only strictly plant based gourmet restaurants in Chicago. There are gourmet vegan options at other restaurants in the city, but none with an entire menu that is made just from delicious plants! The food is really next level. Very reasonable prices from $5-25 per dish and I would say you need a starter and a main per person. Lots of raw options. The $5 taco was actually one of my favorite things! The raw lasagna with macadamia nut cheese was a show stopper.  Absolutely everything we tried on the menu was delicious, and left us both smiling the entire meal, raking in the gorgeous city views and delightful staff!! Do yourself a kindness and visit them soon and often!!
The food is amazing, delicious and healthy. I strongly recommend this restaurant The entire experience is wonderful including staff and views.
Outstanding gourmet vegan fare.
Outstanding food whether you are plant-based or not.  Great flavors and inventive menu.  Highly recommend the Kung Pao Cauliflower and the vegan Tiramisu.
